org.turbogwt.net.http

Class FluentRequestImpl<RequestType,ResponseType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.turbogwt.net.http.FluentRequestImpl<RequestType,ResponseType>
  • Type Parameters:
    RequestType - Type of data to be sent in the HTTP request body, when appropriate.
    ResponseType - Type of result from requests, when appropriate.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>, FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType>, HasUriParts, RequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType>

    public class FluentRequestImpl<RequestType,ResponseType>
extends Object
implements FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType>
    Default implementation of fluent request.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

      • path

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> path(String path)
        Set the URI path. This method will overwrite any existing path and associated matrix parameters. Existing '/' characters are preserved thus a single value can represent multiple URI path segments.
        Specified by:
        path in interface FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>
        Specified by:
        path in interface HasUriParts
        Parameters:
        path - the path; a null value will unset the path component of the URI
        Returns:
        the updated FluentRequestSender

      • segment

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> segment(Object... segments)
                                                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Append path segments to the existing path. When constructing the final path, a '/' separator will be inserted between the existing path and the first path segment if necessary and each supplied segment will also be separated by '/'. Existing '/' characters are encoded thus a single value can only represent a single URI path segment.
        Specified by:
        segment in interface FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>
        Specified by:
        segment in interface HasUriParts
        Parameters:
        segments - the path segment values
        Returns:
        the updated FluentRequestSender
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if segments or any element of segments is null

      • matrixParam

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> matrixParam(String name,
                                                        Object... values)
                                                          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Append a matrix parameter to the existing set of matrix parameters of the current final segment of the URI path. If multiple values are supplied the parameter will be added once per value. Note that the matrix parameters are tied to a particular path segment; subsequent addition of path segments will not affect their position in the URI path.
        Specified by:
        matrixParam in interface FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>
        Specified by:
        matrixParam in interface HasUriParts
        Parameters:
        name - the matrix parameter name
        values - the matrix parameter value(s), each object will be converted to a String using its toString() method.
        Returns:
        the updated FluentRequestSender
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name or values is null
        See Also:
        Matrix URIs

      • queryParam

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> queryParam(String name,
                                                       Object... values)
                                                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Append a query parameter to the existing set of query parameters. If multiple values are supplied the parameter will be added once per value.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        the updated FluentRequestSender
        Throws:

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> header(String header,

        Specified by:

      • timeout

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> timeout(int timeoutMillis)
        Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for a request to complete. Should the request timeout, the RequestCallback.onError(Request, Throwable) method will be called on the callback instance given to the RequestBuilder.sendRequest(String, RequestCallback) method. The callback method will receive an instance of the RequestTimeoutException class as its Throwable argument.
        Specified by:
        timeout in interface FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - number of milliseconds to wait before canceling the request, a value of zero disables timeouts
        Returns:
        the updated FluentRequestSender
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout value is negative

      • on

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> on(int statusCode,
                                               SingleCallback callback)
        Set a callback to handle specific HTTP status code response.

        The informed code can represent a group of codes, e.g. 4 will handle any code in [400,499]. Similarly, 20 will handle any code in [200,209].

        The codes have priority for specificity, e.g. 201 has a higher priority than 20, which has a higher priority than 2.

        Specified by:
        on in interface FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>
        Parameters:
        statusCode - the unit, dozen or hundred expected on response's status code.
        callback - the callback to handle informed code
        Returns:
        the updated FluentRequestSender

      • always

        public FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> always(SingleCallback callback)
        Description copied from interface: FluentRequest
        Define a callback to be called when request is either resolved or rejected.
        The argument is a Callback. When the request is resolved or rejected, the callback is executed.
        Specified by:
        always in interface FluentRequest<RequestType,ResponseType>
        See Also:
        always(callback)

        protected FluentRequestSender<RequestType,ResponseType> setUri(String uri)
